Demonslayer’s Smite.name: Demonslayer’s Smite
Demonslayer’s Smite.fullText:
Demonslayer Attack 11Demonslayer’s Smite

You intone a prayer over your weapon, empowering it to overwhelm demonic defenses.

Encounter        Divine, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee weapon

Target: One creature

Attack: Strength vs. AC. If the target is a demon, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

Hit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target loses its resistances until the end of your next turn.

Special: Whenever a demon within 10 squares of you scores a critical hit or spends an action point, you regain the use of this power.


Published in Divine Power, page(s) 96.
Demonslayer’s Smite.flavor: You intone a prayer over your weapon, empowering it to overwhelm demonic defenses.
Demonslayer’s Smite.attack: Strength vs. AC. If the target is a demon, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
Demonslayer’s Smite.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target loses its resistances until the end of your next turn.
Demonslayer’s Smite.special: Whenever a demon within 10 squares of you scores a critical hit or spends an action point, you regain the use of this power.

Demonslayer’s Resistance.name: Demonslayer’s Resistance
Demonslayer’s Resistance.fullText:
Demonslayer Utility 12Demonslayer’s Resistance

A gleaming halo surrounds you and blunts the attacks of your demonic foes.

Daily        Divine
Immediate Interrupt      Personal

Trigger: An enemy hits you

Effect: You gain resist 5 against damage dealt by the triggering enemy until the end of the encounter. If the triggering enemy is a demon, the resistance increases to 10, and the enemy is subject to your divine sanction until the end of the encounter.
Level 21: Resist 10, or resist 15 if the triggering enemy is a demon.


Published in Divine Power, page(s) 96.
Demonslayer’s Resistance.flavor: A gleaming halo surrounds you and blunts the attacks of your demonic foes.
Demonslayer’s Resistance.effect:
You gain resist 5 against damage dealt by the triggering enemy until the end of the encounter. If the triggering enemy is a demon, the resistance increases to 10, and the enemy is subject to your divine sanction until the end of the encounter.
Level 21: Resist 10, or resist 15 if the triggering enemy is a demon.

Edict of Destruction.name: Edict of Destruction
Edict of Destruction.fullText:
Demonslayer Attack 20Edict of Destruction

You recite words of divine law as you attack, twisting your prey’s very being.

Daily        Divine, Weapon
Standard Action      Melee weapon

Target: One creature

Attack: Strength vs. AC

Hit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is affected by your edict of destruction (save ends). Until the edict ends, roll a d4 at the start of each of the target’s turns to determine the edict’s effect at that time. If the target is a demon, roll two times and apply both results (if you roll the same number twice, roll again).
1. The target and each enemy adjacent to it take 1d10 + your Strength modifier damage.
2. The target gains vulnerable 5 to all damage until the end of your next turn.
3. The target is blinded until the end of your next turn.
4. The target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Miss: Half damage. At the start of the target’s next turn, roll a d4 to determine the effect, as above.


Published in Divine Power, page(s) 96.
Edict of Destruction.flavor: You recite words of divine law as you attack, twisting your prey’s very being.
Edict of Destruction.onHit:

Until the edict ends, roll a d4 at the start of each of the target’s turns to determine the edict’s effect at that time. If the target is a demon, roll two times and apply both results (if you roll the same number twice, roll again).
1. The target and each enemy adjacent to it take 1d10 + your Strength modifier damage.
2. The target gains vulnerable 5 to all damage until the end of your next turn.
3. The target is blinded until the end of your next turn.
4. The target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Edict of Destruction.onMiss: Half damage. At the start of the target’s next turn, roll a d4 to determine the effect, as above.
